Title: Afrobeats made over $100m in 2023 as CSASE laments Africa’s losses
Summary: Afrobeats produced more than $100 million in global value in 2023, yet only a negligible percentage of that revenue reached African creators . This is the central finding of a new report by Harvard’s Centre for the Study of African Economies .

Title: NSCDC intercepts 21 trafficked minors in Kogi, arrests suspected traffickers
Summary: NSCDC intercepted 21 minors suspectedly trafficked from parts of the north into Kogi State . The security agency intercepted the 21 minors in Yagba East local government area of Kogi .

Title: A’Court slashes case backlog by 10,000 last legal year – Court President
Summary: A’Court slashes case backlog by 10,000 last legal year – Court President . Case backlog dropped from 41,952 appeals in the 2023/2024 legal year to 31,618 .

Title: Court orders Tinubu, NNPC boss, EFCC to respond to suit seeking Ojulari’s sack
Summary: High Court orders Tinubu, NNPC boss, EFCC to respond to suit seeking to compel Bayo Ojulari's sack . The High Court of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) has issued an order directing President Bola Taku and the Group Chief Executive Officer of the Nigerian National Petroleum Company (NNPC

Title: PDP’s Ajadi visits Ogbomoso North, woos grassroots ahead of 2027
Summary: Ambassador Olufemi Ajadi Oguntoyinbo paid a courtesy visit to the Ogbomoso North Local Government Council as part of his ongoing campaign . Ambassador Ajadi is a leading governorship aspirant in Oyo State on the platform of the PDP .

Title: Army dismisses claim of soldiers shooting civilians during Adamawa clash
Summary: The Army expressed condolences to the affected families and appealed for calm . It urged the Bachama and Chobo communities to embrace peace and avoid further bloodshed .

Title: NYSC is your chance to know Nigeria, Kaduna gov tells corps members
Summary: Kaduna gov tells corps members to prioritise their safety, remain vigilant, and always report any suspicious situation to the appropriate authorities . NYSC is your chance to know Nigeria, the Kaduna governor told corps members .

Title: Mbappe misses training ahead of Man City clash
Summary: Mbappe misses training ahead of Man City clash . The 26-year-old striker has scored 25 goals in 21 matches across all competitions this season .

Title: Plane crashes into traffic during emergency landing in Florida
Summary: A small multi-engine aircraft crashed into traffic on a major Florida highway Monday night after attempting an emergency landing . Authorities said the plane was trying to land on a Florida highway .

Title: Zelensky meets pope, prepares revised plan on Russia war
Summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky met with Pope Leo XIV in Italy on Tuesday as he prepared to send the U.S. revised proposals to end Russia's invasion .

Title: Zelensky meets Pope, prepares revised plan on Russia war
Summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky met with Pope Leo XIV at his country residence in Castel Gandolfo near Rome . He is to meet Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni later . Meloni has been a staunch supporter of Kyiv since Russia’s February 2022 invasion .

Title: NSCDC assures FCT residents of safe yuletide celebrations
Summary: The Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps assured residents of the Federal Capital Territory of a peaceful Christmas and New Year celebration . The commandant of NSCDC, Dr Olusola Odumosu, emphasised that the Command is working “round the clock’s clock to ensure that residents of FCT enjoy a hitch-

Title: Police warn against fireworks, bush burning in Enugu
Summary: The Enugu State Police Command has reiterated its ban on the sale and unauthorised use of fireworks during the festive season, warning that violators will face prosecution . Commissioner of Police Mamman Giwa restated the directive in a statement issued through the Command’s spokesperson, SP Daniel Ndukwe, late Monday night .

Title: Army denies shooting civilians during Adamawa communal clash
Summary: Headquarters 23 Brigade of the Nigerian Army has rejected reports that its troops were involved in shooting civilians during a communal clash in Lamurde Local Government Area, Adamawa State, on Monday, 8 December 2025 . Title: Kidnapping children lesser evil than killing soldiers — Gumi
Summary: Islamic cleric Sheikh Gumi has described the kidnapping of schoolchildren as a “lesser evil” compared to killing soldiers .
